com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.parameters

Class ValidityPeriod

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.parameters.ValidityPeriod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ValidityPeriod
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    ValidityPeriod.java

    Created on 5 January 2011, 17:34

    Represents the time period that the submitted message is valid for. Once this time period has elapsed, if it has not yet been delivered, then delivery will be aborted and the message will be expired.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Paul Cook
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ValidityPeriod

        public ValidityPeriod(int validityPeriodHours,
              int validityPeriodMinutes,
              int validityPeriodSeconds)
        Instanciate a new ValidityPeriod instance, specifying the time-to-live as a number of hours, minutes and seconds
        Parameters:
        validityPeriodHours - the number of hours that make up the validity period for this message
        validityPeriodMinutes - the number of minutes that make up the validity period for this message
        validityPeriodSeconds - the number of seconds that make up the validity period for this message
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the validity period is a negative timespam
